document.title: Visual and Performing Arts Learning Results: Parameters for Essential Instruction

08825A40DFE601313B7468A86D17958E.description: Following established rules/etiquette for observing/listening to art

087FCC10DFE601313B6C68A86D17958E.description: Students identify positive interpersonal skills that impact the quality of their art and participation in the arts.

087F2B40DFE601313B6A68A86D17958E.description: Describe the way the arts can make people feel.

087E8810DFE601313B6868A86D17958E.description: Identify the activities and careers of a visual or performing artist.

087E3970DFE601313B6768A86D17958E.description: Students identify the arts in life experiences.

087DF730DFE601313B6668A86D17958E.description: Impact of the Arts on Lifestyle and Career

087DB460DFE601313B6568A86D17958E.description: Students identify choices that lead to success in the arts.

087D2620DFE601313B6368A86D17958E.description: Students identify connections between and among the arts and other disciplines.

087C8400DFE601313B6168A86D17958E.description: Students identify family or community symbols and celebrations in the visual/performing arts from different world cultures.

087C1830DFE601313B6068A86D17958E.description: The Arts and History and World Cultures

087BC430DFE601313B5F68A86D17958E.description: Visual and Performing Arts Connections: Students understand the relationship among the arts, history and world culture; and they make connections among the arts and to other disciplines, to goal-setting, and to interpersonal interaction.

087B7D00DFE601313B5E68A86D17958E.description: Recognize a variety of purposes for making/performing art works, including telling a story and communicating emotions and ideas.

087B26F0DFE601313B5D68A86D17958E.description: Ask questions about the art form to further understand how the artist created/performed the work of art.

087ADE00DFE601313B5C68A86D17958E.description: Describe the art form by applying grade span appropriate arts concepts, terminology, skills, and processes as referenced in Standard A: Disciplinary Literacy.

087A98B0DFE601313B5B68A86D17958E.description: Students observe, listen to, describe and ask questions about art forms.

087A1200DFE601313B5968A86D17958E.description: Aesthetics and Criticism: Students describe analyze, interpret, and evaluate art (dance, music, theatre, and visual arts).

0879CD80DFE601313B5868A86D17958E.description: Imagine and share possible solutions to apply to challenges in creating art.

08798330DFE601313B5768A86D17958E.description: Improvise to solve problems in the performing arts.

08793420DFE601313B5668A86D17958E.description: Students identify and demonstrate creative problem-solving skills.

0878ADA0DFE601313B5468A86D17958E.description: Creative Problem Solving: Students approach artistic problem-solving using multiple solutions and the creative process.

08749F50DFE601313B4768A86D17958E.description: Although no performance indicators are stated, students may participate in the preparation of art for display and all students are expected to have instructional experiences that help them to understand how art is prepared for display and why different choices related to preparation may be made.

08740D20DFE601313B4568A86D17958E.description: Students create art works that communicate ideas and feelings and demonstrate skill in the use of media, tools, and techniques.

08737D80DFE601313B4368A86D17958E.description: Students use Elements Of Art and Principles Of Design to create original art works.

0872E3D0DFE601313B4168A86D17958E.description: Students use basic media, tools and techniques to create original art works.

087242A0DFE601313B3F68A86D17958E.description: Creation, Performance, and Expression - Visual Arts: Students create, express, and communicate through the art discipline.

0876B8C0DFE601313B4E68A86D17958E.description: Students improvise through theatre games by using plot, setting, and characters.

0875F8F0DFE601313B4C68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate a character by participating in skits, puppet shows, and/or theatre games.

08756860DFE601313B4A68A86D17958E.description: Students participate in skits, puppet shows, theatre games, and/or show and tell using movement skills.

0874E3E0DFE601313B4868A86D17958E.description: Creation, Performance, and Expression - Theatre: Students create, perform and express through the art discipline.

08786630DFE601313B5368A86D17958E.description: Students use knowledge and skills of standard and non-standard notation, symbols, and terminology of dynamics.

0877BE60DFE601313B5168A86D17958E.description: Students create or perform short musical selections of various styles and genres accurately applying selected knowledge and skills of: proper posture and technique; notation; symbols; and terminology of dynamics.

08770840DFE601313B4F68A86D17958E.description: Creation, Performance, and Expression - Music: Students create, perform, and express through the art discipline.

0871E980DFE601313B3E68A86D17958E.description: Students identify possible props or costumes to enhance a short dance phrase.

087162D0DFE601313B3C68A86D17958E.description: Students solve a variety of movement challenges alone or in a group.

0870CB80DFE601313B3A68A86D17958E.description: Students develop a short dance sequence with a beginning, middle, and end.

08700EC0DFE601313B3868A86D17958E.description: Although no performance indicators are stated students are expected to have instructional experiences that help them to express themselves through movement

086F82C0DFE601313B3668A86D17958E.description: Creation, Performance, and Expression - Dance: Students create, perform, and express ideas through the art discipline.

08653C20DFE601313B1468A86D17958E.description: Students name art media and associated tools, for multiple art forms and genres.

0864B480DFE601313B1268A86D17958E.description: Identify Principles of Design including pattern and balance.

08646B50DFE601313B1168A86D17958E.description: Identify Elements of Art: color, form, line, shape, space, texture, and value.

0863C9A0DFE601313B0F68A86D17958E.description: Elements of Art and Principles of Design

08636E20DFE601313B0E68A86D17958E.description: Students recognize a variety of purposes for making art, including telling a story, communicating emotion, or beautifying functional objects.

0862C490DFE601313B0C68A86D17958E.description: Disciplinary Literacy - Visual Arts: Students show literacy in the art discipline by understanding and demonstrating concepts, skills, terminology, and processes.

086971A0DFE601313B2268A86D17958E.description: Students select or make props, costumes, set pieces, and/or puppets, and practice using them appropriately.

0868D3F0DFE601313B2068A86D17958E.description: Students identify the "who, what, where, when, and why" of a dramatic performance they have participated in or seen.

08682CF0DFE601313B1E68A86D17958E.description: Disciplinary Literacy - Theatre: Students show literacy in the art discipline by understanding and demonstrating concepts, skills, terminology, and processes.

0867CF50DFE601313B1D68A86D17958E.description: Students listen to and identify elements of music including meter and simple form and attributes including loud/soft, fast/slow, high/low, and long/short beat and steady/strong beat.

08674540DFE601313B1B68A86D17958E.description: Identify symbols and traditional terms referring to dynamics.

08670360DFE601313B1A68A86D17958E.description: Read whole and half notes in 4/4 meter signatures.

0866C040DFE601313B1968A86D17958E.description: Students identify and read musical notation, symbols, and terminology of dynamics.

08662C40DFE601313B1768A86D17958E.description: Students accurately perform a short musical selection, both instrumentally and vocally, while modeling proper posture and technique, alone or with others.

086584D0DFE601313B1568A86D17958E.description: Disciplinary Literacy - Music: Students show literacy in the discipline by understanding and demonstrating concepts, skills, terminology, and processes.

086F3AC0DFE601313B3568A86D17958E.description: Students replicate, with a partner, the dance composition forms of copying, mirroring, leading, and following.

086E5230DFE601313B3268A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate locomotor patterns using change in direction, level, and pathway.

086E07C0DFE601313B3168A86D17958E.description: Identify the difference between a locomotor and non-locomotor/axial skill.

086DB540DFE601313B3068A86D17958E.description: Students identify and demonstrate locomotor and non-locomotor/axial skills.

086D05A0DFE601313B2E68A86D17958E.description: Students recognize and demonstrate hard/soft, light/strong, and resting/moving movements to show differences in energy qualities.

086C7330DFE601313B2C68A86D17958E.description: Students replicate tempo change using body movement.

086BDF80DFE601313B2A68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate space concepts including high/low, forward/backward, near/far, and personal space and wide/narrow, and stretched/curled/twisted shape(s).

086B2550DFE601313B2868A86D17958E.description: Identify elements of energy: hard/soft, light/strong, and resting/moving.

086ACC00DFE601313B2768A86D17958E.description: Identify elements of time: steady and fast/slow beat.

086A8660DFE601313B2668A86D17958E.description: Identify elements of space: high/low, forward/backward, near/far, and personal space, and wide/narrow and stretched/curled/twisted shape(s).

086A43C0DFE601313B2568A86D17958E.description: Students identify space, time, and energy concepts.

0869BB30DFE601313B2368A86D17958E.description: Disciplinary Literacy - Dance: Students show literacy in the discipline through understanding and demonstrating concepts, skills, terminology, and processes.
